question: Appropriation Accounts so prepared by the C&AG is compared with _____
answer: The accounts of voted grants and charged appropriations for the different purposes as specified in the schedules appended to the Appropriation Acts passed by the legislature

question: The responsibility of the C&AG is extended to grants/appropriations even in respect of which the accounts are not maintained by the Indian Audit and Accounts Department-True/False
answer: False. It is confined to grants/appropriations in respect of which the accounts are maintained by the IA&AD.

question: The compilation of accounts of the Union and of each State was provisioned under____
answer: Section 10 of the DPC Act 1971

question: The compilation of accounts of the Union and of each State is done from the initial and subsidiary accounts rendered to the Audit and the Accounts Offices by____
answer: Treasuries, offices or departments under his control by responsible for the keeping of such accounts.

question: Appropriation Accounts indicates the _____ (gross/net) expenditure against each grant
answer: Gross (Excluding deductions and recoveries)

question: Finance Accounts shows _____ (gross/net) expenditure under different heads.
answer: Net expenditure after taking into account deduction and recoveries. Due to this there is variation between the figures in the Finance Accounts an Appropriation Accounts.

question: There are____ parts of an Appropriation Accounts.
answer: Three. Part I- Summary of Appropriation Accounts & Audit Certificate of CAG; Part II- Detailed Appropriation Accounts and Part III- Appendices.

question: The audit certificate of the CAG is recorded in which part of the Appropriation Accounts?
answer: Part I (below the Summary of Appropriation Accounts)

question: ________(part of Appropriation Accounts) shows the total amounts of funds (original and supplementary) provided by the legislature under each voted grants and charges appropriation separately for Revenue and Capital and actual expenditure incurred against each grant.
answer: Part I- Summary of Appropriation Accounts

question: The Summary of Appropriation Accounts is followed by the grand total of the amount of Grant/Appropriation under revenue and capital and against voted grant and charged appropriation-True/False
answer: TRUE

question: The Summary of Appropriation Accounts is concluded with a reconciliation statement of expenditure indicated in Appropriation Accounts with those indicated_______
answer: Finance Accounts

question: The three elements that should be provisioned in the Appendix I to Summary of Appropriation Accounts are____
answer: (i) the expenditure met out of advances from the Contingency Fund which were not recouped to the Fund before the close of the year by authorisation of the Legislature. ; (ii) reconciliation of the total expenditure according to Appropriation Accounts with that shown in the Finance Accounts after taking into account recoveries of expenditure  ; (iii)  drawing attention to cases of excesses over grants/appropriations requiring regularisation.

question: The reconciliation statement of the figures given in Appropriation and Finance Accounts exhibits three elements. Those are____
answer: (i) total expenditure according to Appropriation Accounts; (ii) total of recoveries, and (iii) net total expenditure as shown in the Finance Accounts

question: A detailed statement showing recoveries relating to each grant/appropriation should be the included as an appendix to the ________
answer: Appropriation Accounts (Appendix II)

question: The Appropriation Accounts relating to State Governments are prepared by the respective State Accountants General (A&E) except in case of the State Government of ______
answer: Goa and Union Territory Government of Pondicherry

question: The Appropriation Accounts and Finance Accounts are compiled by the_____
answer: AG (A&E).

question: The draft Appropriation Accounts and Finance Accounts is sent to Accountant General (Audit) for carry out an independent check after a check by _______
answer: ITA Wing  under AG (Audit)

question: It is not necessary as all the three documents i.e. Appropriation Accounts, Finance Accounts and Audit Report on these accounts should be submitted to the State Legislature simultaneously-True/False
answer: False. (These documents are forwarded simultaneously to the CAG for countersignature/ signature)

question: ________ is fully responsible for finally submitting both the draft accounts and printed copies of the Accounts.
answer: The Accountant General (A&E).

question: ______prepares the Combined Finance and Revenue Accounts.
answer: The CAG

question: An advance copy of the draft of the Appropriation Accounts of the grant/appropriation and the draft Notes and Comments proposed to be inscribed therein should be sent by _____ to ____
answer: The Compiling Officer, each authority responsible for controlling expenditure against a grant/appropriation.

question: Which is transmitted first to AG (Audit) by AG (A&E)- Appropriation accounts or Finance Accounts?
answer: Finance Accounts (FA by 5th October, AA by 25th October)

question: The important time schedules with respect to preparation and submission of Appropriation and Finance Accounts are____
answer: (i)Finance Accounts: Transmission to AG (Audit) by AG (A&E)- by 5th October every year; Return to AG (A&E) by AG (Audit)- by 25th October every year; Handing over to the Press for printing- by 5th November every year.(ii)Appropriation Accounts:  Transmission to AG (Audit) by AG (A&E)- by 16th November; Return to AG (A&E) by AG (Audit)- by 2th October every year; Handing over to the Press for printing- by 25th Nov every year.

question: The observations/comments of the AG (Audit) will be attended to and settled by the concerned AG (A&E) within _____of the return of the checked copies of the Finance Accounts and Appropriation Accounts
answer: one week

question: The Accountant General (A&E) shall furnish_____ progress report about printing of the Appropriation Accounts and Finance Accounts to the CAG
answer: fort-nightly

question: AG (A&E) will furnish ____ Printed (bound) copies of the Appropriation Accounts and Finance Accounts of their respective States to the CAG for signature so as these could be available for presentation to the Legislature during the ______session
answer: Five (05), Budget

question: _______ copies of Appropriation Accounts and Finance Accounts are required by the CAG _____(including/excluding) one for transmission to the Press Information Bureau of the Government of India) after the documents are placed before the Legislature.
answer: Nineteen (19), including.

question: The AG (A&E) furnishes certificate to Appropriation and Finance Accounts in pursuance of provision contained in_____
answer: Article 149 and provisions of the DPC Act, 1971

question: The AG (Audit) furnishes certificate to Appropriation and Finance Accounts in pursuance of provision contained in_____
answer: Article 149 & 151 and provisions of the DPC Act, 1971

question: Any error noticed in the printed copies of the Appropriation Accounts or/and Finance Accounts before forwarding to the Government should be corrected ______
answer: by neatly correcting in manuscript in the copies sent to the CAG or by printing errata.

question: Where any error is noticed in Appropriation and Finance Accounts after they were forwarded to the Government, the matter should be brought to the notice of______
answer: the CAG

question: In cases where a correction slip is required to be issued after the Appropriation and Finance Accounts have been forwarded to Government, the same may be issued in the name of_____
answer: The Accountant General (A&E) who was responsible for preparation of the accounts. The slip does not bear any date.

question: The CAG should ensure that any such correction slip issued after the accounts have been forwarded to the Government is pasted in the copies signed by the Comptroller and Auditor General which are to be laid on the table of the legislature-True/False
answer: False. It will be ensured by the AG (A&E) who issued correction slip.

question: In cases where an error is noticed after the accounts are laid before the legislature, correction slip will be issued by____
answer: No correction slips can be issued. But they should be reported to the CAG with an explanation for the delay in noticing them.

question: Appropriation Accounts/Finance Accounts to be classified as ______ till their presentation to the Legislature
answer: Confidential

question: The Finance Accounts are prepared in _____ parts
answer: Two- Part I- Summarised Statements and Part II- Detailed Statements

question: Financial results of irrigation schemes are included in which part of Finance Accounts?
answer: Part I- Summarised Statement. Also go thorough other statements accordingly.

question: Proforma accounts bringing out the financial results of Government’s commercial and trading activities are included in the Finance Accounts-True/False.
answer: False. It is not included in Finance Accounts.

question: Who renders a certificate stating  he is satisfied that the balances whether in cash or investments, under each head under “Debt, Deposits and Remittances” have been duly verified and found to agree with the relevant record  and in which accounts?
answer: AG (Audit), Finance Accounts

question: The printed copies of the Appropriation Accounts and Finance Accounts should be submitted to the Comptroller and Auditor General for his signature at the latest by _____
answer: the 31st January

question: The classification of government transactions in Appropriation and Finance Accounts should follow the ______
answer: Budget

question: The main thrust of Appropriation Accounts is to focus and highlight _____
answer: Major excesses/savings

question: Re-appropriation orders relating to the previous years after closure of Accounts should _____(be/not be accepted and acted upon) in preparation of Appropriation Accounts
answer: not be accepted and acted upon

question: When huge provision of funds are made through re-appropriation under New Service, ______ should be briefed and suitable guidelines issued in the matter.
answer: Public Accounts Committee

question: The nomenclature of the Head of Account should conform to the classification given in the_____
answer: List of Major and Minor Heads of Accounts

question: Who has to conduct a check while scrutiny of the Finance Accounts that variation between Revised Estimates and actuals have been properly examined to ensure that no serious misclassifications have occurred?
answer: ITA

question: While checking the draft Finance Accounts, the ITA should see that entire balance under __________(major head) has been transferred to ______(major head)
answer: 8782 Cash Balance- Remittances etc.-Cash Remittances between Treasuries & Currency Chests, “8999 Cash Balance- Remittances in Transit (Article 8.11 of the Account Code for AG)

question: In Detailed Statement of Receipts, Disbursements and Balances under Heads of Account relating to Debt, Contingency Fund and Public Account, no balance should appear against the head _______the entire account balance should be shown against _____
answer: “8675-Reserve Bank Deposits”, “8999-Cash Balance-Deposits with Reserve Bank.

question: Minor head “Writes-off from heads of account closing to balance” is located under the Major Head____
answer: 8680- Miscellaneous Government Account

question: The figures appearing against this head in Statement titled Detailed Statement of Receipts, Disbursements and Balances Under Heads of Account Relating to Debt, Contingency Fund And Public Account (current debits/credits), should be verified with reference to the sanctions issued by_____
answer: The CAG or by the AG in certain cases

question: In Appropriation and Finance Accounts, the letter ‘R’ stands for ____
answer: Re-appropriations, withdrawals or surrenders sanctioned by a competent authority. O-Original grant/appropriation, S-Supplementary grant/appropriation

question: Which type of expenditure is shown in italics in annual accounts ______
answer: Charged Expenditure

question: The monetary limits and/or percentages with respect to excess/savings may be prescribed by___
answer: The State PAC

question: Where the monetary limits and/or percentages with respect to excess/savings are prescribed the Accountant General should not include cases falling within such limit or percentage irrespective of the fact that he considers such cases important enough to bring to the notice of the Legislature irrespective of the limits-True/False
answer: False. The AG is open to include cases which considers important irrespective of the limits.

question: Funds made available under Vote on Account may be utilized for expenditure on a ‘New Service’- True/False
answer: False.

question: Block of major heads under the Sector E Public Debt within the Consolidated Fund is ____
answer: 6001 to 6005.;  (i) Tax Revenue Receipt (A): 0020 to 0045 (0005 to 0008-GST) ;  (ii) Non-Tax Revenue Receipt (B): 0046 to 1475;  (iii) Grant-in-Aid & Contribution (C): 1601 to 1606;  (iv) Revenue Expenditure (A to D) : 2020 to 3606. (General/Social/Eco/GIA);  (v) Capital Receipt: 4000;  (vi) Capital Expenditure (A to D): 4046 to 5475 (General/Social/Eco/GIA);  (vii) Loan & Advances (F): 6075 to 7615;  (viii) Inter-State Settlement (G): 7810;  (ix) Transfer to Contingency Fund (H): 7999;  (x) Contingency Fund: 8000;  (x) Public Accounts (I to N): 8001 to 8999

question: Reserve Funds are locate within which part of the Government Accounts?
answer: Public Accounts (Sector J:8115 to 8235). It is divided into two types-Interest bearing and non-interest bearing

question: Deposits in government accounts are ____types.
answer: Two types-Interest bearing and non-interest bearing.

question: In statements of Appropriation Accounts and Finance Account the amount may be written in lakh or crore of rupees but in the explanatory notes the amounts may be mentioned_____
answer: in crores of rupees

question: In the statement relating to Guarantees given By the State Government, the details of guarantees given by the State Govt. to______ are included.
answer: 1. Statutory Corporations  2. Municipal Corporations and Other local bodies  3. Government Companies 4. Other Joint Stock  Companies 5. Co-operative Banks and Societies and 6. Other institutions

question: In detailed statement of capital expenditure detail individual works/schemes shall be included where the sanctioned estimate/actual progressive expenditure of a project works/schemes exceeds Rs.____
answer: 50 lakhs or such other limit fixed by Headquarters office.

question: Details of loans and Advances by the State Government are shown _____ head wise.
answer: Minor

question: The individual loans and advances may be mentioned in the detailed statement of Loan and Advance only when the balances at the end of the year _____
answer: Exceeds Rs. 25 lakhs or any higher amount fixed by Headquarters office.

question: In the case of Finance Accounts, the figures in the summarized statements may be rounded off to crores or lakhs of rupees as may be convenient whereas in the detailed accounts and statement, the figures should be given in ______
answer: units of rupees.

question: In the case of Appropriation Accounts while the Appropriation Accounts of each grant/appropriation will give the figures units of rupees, in the case of group heads selected for comment the figures will be given in ___
answer: lakhs of Rupees to two points of decimal.

question: All the statements of Appropriation and Finance Accounts should be printed_____
answer: Vertically and not horizontally.
